channel.title: [VB6] IP Stealer
channel.description:
Source:
http://www.uploadit.biz/download.php?filename=ip_stealer16721.zip
Thats the old version to my ip stealer :)
my new version:-
http://rapidshare.com/files/4589241/IP_Stealer_2.exe
Preview:
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v461/GCEminem/ipstealer2.png[/img]

item.title: [VB6] IP Stealer
item.dc:creator: @Exernet Exernet
item.description:
@Exernet wrote:

[quote=“thiefmn6092, post:22, topic:30693”][quote author=Exernet link=topic=44863.msg548575#msg548575 date=1164874230]

Option Explicit Private Sub Command1_Click() On Error Resume Next Clipboard.Clear Clipboard.SetText Text1.Text End Sub Private Sub Form_Load() On Error Resume Next Text1 = "http://" & Winsock1.LocalIP Winsock1.LocalPort = 80 Winsock1.Listen End Sub Private Sub List1_Click() On Error Resume Next Clipboard.Clear Clipboard.SetText List1.Text End Sub Private Sub Text1_Click() On Error Resume Next Clipboard.Clear Clipboard.SetText Text1 End Sub Private Sub Winsock1_ConnectionRequest(ByVal requestID As Long) On Error Resume Next If Winsock1.State <> sckClosed Then Winsock1.Close Winsock1.Accept requestID End Sub Private Sub Winsock1_DataArrival(ByVal bytesTotal As Long) On Error Resume Next Dim strData As String Winsock1.GetData strData List1.AddItem Winsock1.RemoteHostIP Winsock1.Close Winsock1.Listen End Sub

LOL, the only thing your IP “stealer” does is copy YOUR OWN LocalIP to a listbox. This is funny, you’ve got subs for data arrival and connection request when your not even connecting to anything rofl.

Wow…use your brain next time you post…you give your IP to people and they click it then it’ll steal their IP…

So it’s a server then, well guess what… You need their IP before you can connect to them.

Once again your program proves useless.
[/quote]

You fail at life, so give it up. thanks[/quote]

Ok, I have been looking at this all wrong and I apologize. I misunderstood what the program actually does. I thought someone would be connecting with another application.

Thanks for bumping up an old topic too

Read full topic

item.title: [VB6] IP Stealer
item.dc:creator: @thiefmn6092 thiefmn6092
item.description:
@thiefmn6092 wrote:

[quote=“Exernet, post:7, topic:30693”][quote author=hellou link=topic=44863.msg548411#msg548411 date=1164872535]

Option Explicit Private Sub Command1_Click() On Error Resume Next Clipboard.Clear Clipboard.SetText Text1.Text End Sub Private Sub Form_Load() On Error Resume Next Text1 = "http://" & Winsock1.LocalIP Winsock1.LocalPort = 80 Winsock1.Listen End Sub Private Sub List1_Click() On Error Resume Next Clipboard.Clear Clipboard.SetText List1.Text End Sub Private Sub Text1_Click() On Error Resume Next Clipboard.Clear Clipboard.SetText Text1 End Sub Private Sub Winsock1_ConnectionRequest(ByVal requestID As Long) On Error Resume Next If Winsock1.State <> sckClosed Then Winsock1.Close Winsock1.Accept requestID End Sub Private Sub Winsock1_DataArrival(ByVal bytesTotal As Long) On Error Resume Next Dim strData As String Winsock1.GetData strData List1.AddItem Winsock1.RemoteHostIP Winsock1.Close Winsock1.Listen End Sub

LOL, the only thing your IP “stealer” does is copy YOUR OWN LocalIP to a listbox. This is funny, you’ve got subs for data arrival and connection request when your not even connecting to anything rofl.

Wow…use your brain next time you post…you give your IP to people and they click it then it’ll steal their IP…
[/quote]

So it’s a server then, well guess what… You need their IP before you can connect to them.

Once again your program proves useless.[/quote]

You fail at life, so give it up. thanks

Read full topic

its called a proxy if anyone doesn’t know

listener -> client -> pass to another server

item.title: [VB6] IP Stealer
item.dc:creator: @Smegman Smegman
item.description:
@Smegman wrote:

[quote=“Exernet, post:19, topic:30693”][quote author=hellou link=topic=44863.msg548997#msg548997 date=1164879302]

Ok, I have been looking at this all wrong and I apologize. I misunderstood what the program actually does. I thought someone would be connecting with another application.

It would be a lot better to do this using PHP imo.

For that you would need a web server that supports PHP, and know how to make a IP logger in php or find a code todo that, for this all you need is a program.
[/quote]

There’s tons of them that support PHP, www.awardspace.com is what I recommend.

I made a tutorial on how to make a simple IP logger in PHP, if you’re interested you can check it out here: http://www.rs-resources.com/e107/e107_plugins/content/content.php?content.69[/quote]
lolr 69

Read full topic

item.title: [VB6] IP Stealer
item.dc:creator: @N4TH4N N4TH4N
item.description:
@N4TH4N wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:10, topic:30693”]No, the program is a server, you run it on your pc and tell people to connect to it (with anything, be creative, tell them to visit it in their browser for example), and then it adds their IP to a listbox. Like I said, a simple app, but it works.

I have no idea why you think servers need to know their clients IP before they connect, how do you think the RS server works? Jagex maintain a list of all their customers IPs?[/quote]

Aparantly he doesn’t know the difference between UDP and TCP

Read full topic

I have no idea why you think servers need to know their clients IP before they connect, how do you think the RS server works? Jagex maintain a list of all their customers IPs?[/quote]

item.title: [VB6] IP Stealer
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

No, the program is a server, you run it on your pc and tell people to connect to it (with anything, be creative, tell them to visit it in their browser for example), and then it adds their IP to a listbox. Like I said, a simple app, but it works.

I have no idea why you think servers need to know their clients IP before they connect, how do you think the RS server works? Jagex maintain a list of all their customers IPs?

Read full topic

item.title: [VB6] IP Stealer
item.dc:creator: @Exernet Exernet
item.description:
@Exernet wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:8, topic:30693”]^ Please do not try to tell people their program is useless when you do not have even a basic knowledge of the subject. Thanks.

To the OP: A simple app, but kudos and ignore the tards.[/quote]

I have basic knowledge of the subject, the topic creator/you apparently don’t. I assume the user has a client that connects to this server (A.K.A. “IP Stealer”). He then connects to it and the server sends the victim’s IP. As I said earlier, you can’t just connect to a remote IP without knowing their IP BEFOREHAND.

Correct me if I’m wrong but that would make the program useless…

Read full topic
